The heavily guarded and shuttered Egyptian Museum in Cairo is next to Tahrir Square, a protest encampment that draws hundreds of thousands of people on some days. We will open the museum after the strike is finished. I don't know when the strike is finished, said Antiquities Minister Zahi Hawass , referring to the upheaval.`` I need things to go back to normal.'' What?s awkward is the fact that, for whatever reason, the administration was incapable of persuading people that that was a first-class operation, that they were not torturing people, that they were not hurting people, he said. Welch explained the date change Vermont seeks to enable a swifter move toward a singlepayer system meshes with flexibility conservative politicians might also like because of their opposition to federal control of health care. My argument to them is why not let states experiment? So it is a state's rights argument, Welch said. Sen. Bernie Sanders added that the date change wouldn't cost the federal government anything extra, doesn't mention the word singlepayer but would hold states to all the requirements of the law.
